headline: Quinoa with Veggies
description: I love quinoa and I wanted to make something that was flavorful and filling. The vegetables can be changed to your liking!
name: Quinoa with Veggies

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the quinoa, water, and 1 pinch of salt to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender, about 20 minutes. Once done, drain a mesh strainer, and set aside.

Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the garlic, and cook until the garlic softens and the aroma mellows, about 2 minutes. Add the red pepper, and corn; continue cooking until the pepper softens, about 5 minutes. Season with cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper, and cook for 1 minute more, then stir in the cooked quinoa and green onions. Serve hot or cold.

review.reviewBody: I made the quinoa in a rice cooker and then added the sauteed vegetables. It was easy to make and added flavor to plain quinoa.
I love quinoa and this is my new favorite way to make it. I recommend 2 cups of water per cup of quinoa vice 3 as written. Consider garnishing with fresh cilantro if you have some. Great recipe!
I love it! It was really tasty and easy!
I messed up and used vegetable JUICE (V8) instead of vegetable BROTH! LOL! Still was delicious! Definitely will make it again!
I made the dish with red quinoa. It is a good flavor and consistency, plus was simple to make.
not to my taste,i think I would stay with rice

Sautéed all vegetables together, then added quinoa & only 2 cups of vegetable broth. Brought to boil then reduced heat to cook for about 20 minutes. Used stated ingredients except onions. Will make again using different vegetables, reminded me of a pilaf.
I think I might have run low on garlic. It didn't have much flavor but that was probably user error. I can never seem to make quinoa taste right!
Delicious as is

It was the first time I had quinoa and this recipe is so delisious. My whole family loves it! It was so good that I have made it two days in a row :) And it is very easy to make!! 5 star for sure and has been added to my saved list.
Really enjoyed this. Followed the recipe and will make again.
Second time I made it. Added lemon juice, celery, and chicken. Wonderful dish! Both my male roommates loved it.
This was so good me and husband both loved it. thanks

This is fantastic! My entire family enjoys this as a side or main dish. This is not something that happens often. I use vegetable broth or chicken broth instead of water to give a bit more flavor, but that's just personal preference. May be just as tasty without that step.

This was my first time cooking Quinoa. My family found it fairly bland. But I plan on making it again. So next time I will try cooking it with chicken or other broth to add some flavor, or adding soy sauce. I added lots of extra vegetables to make it a combo dish of grain and lots of vegetables. I added fresh corn cut off the cob, mushrooms, broccoli, and red peppers.
I used 4 cloves crushed garlic, added a diced jalapeño and string beans. The flavouring with the cumin and oregano is perfect.
this is an excellent dish we used chicken broth and added some lemon to get a bit more flavour very very happy with how this turned out thank you for sharing!
I loved this recipe, I add cooked chicken and other vegetables to beef it up. I take the leftovers for lunch.

This was my first time ever cooking quinoa and this recipe was a great place to start - very simple and straightforward! I added red onion, which I enjoyed. I'm looking forward to making this recipe again and possibly adding tofu and a few other items. :)
This was delicious!!! Made it tonight as a side dish. The whole family enjoyed it. There's great texture and flavor. It was a great accompaniment to the grilled chicken. Thanks for the recipe!
Yummy! I also added asparagus and it was the bomb..

This was so awesome. My husband and I have never had Quinoa before and I had just picked up a pkg to try. Didn't even know how to cook it. I followed the recipe to a "T" with two exceptions. I used a reviewers tip and just used 2 cups of liquid vs 3 and I also used chicken broth instead of water. It came out perfectly! We will definitely use this recipe again. Thanks so much for sharing!!!

It wa delicious! I used a little yellow onion because I didnt have green onion or bell peppers. I used an entire can of corn and added chopped up avocado after serving. My teenage daughter liked it, too. I will definitely make it again, next time with green onion and bell peppers. But I am keeping the extra corn and avocado!
Soooo good! Tomorrow night won't come soon enough. The directions are spot-on! Enjoy!
Cooked the quinoa in chicken broth. Added sauteed onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, spinach and frozen mixed veggies.
Super easy to make.. in just 30 mins!
This is very tasty as I cooked red onion and garlic together, added the cumin and oregano along with some corn and black beans and 1-2 T of tomato paste.

My family really enjoyed this recipe. I also used 2 cups of water instead of 3. I did not put corn because I did not have any but still tasted good. I put 1 packet of chicken bouillon to the water while it was boiling.
Very bland. Will add more seasonings next time

I love quinoa. Always looking for go to recipe with it. I followed the cooking directions. I did add more ingredients, carrots, kale, chard, and lots more garlic. I used fresh oregano because that is what I had. Along with cumin I added a bit of curry powder. yum yum.. It tastes great.
Made exactly as recipe stated. Perfect !!
I'm making this recipe for the third time now in the last few months. It's a great side dish. I use fresh corn cut off the cob and don't forget the cumin.
i really like this recipe...added some chop bell peppers and even had my co-worker who never had Quinoa before try it and she loved it :)

I loved this! Even my non-heath food eating husband loved this.... which is kinda too bad because I ate most of it on my own. I liked this warmed up and made mine with half water half chicken stock and added peas, carrots, and corn as my veggies. I'm so glad I found this recipe and can't wait to try new veggies and maybe some diced chicken and shrimp!
This recipe tastes good. First time for me to eat quinoa. I added 1 stalk of celery along with red bell peppers and some veggies. Hubby loves it too.
It was very good. Substituted the corn to carrots due to my child has crohn's.
We found this dish to be bland. Perhaps if it is paired with a strongly flavored main dish it would be good.
Very good! I reduced quinoa to 1.5 cups and added chopped zucchini and onions. It went great with the healthy turkey loaf (recipe on this site).
I thought this was awful, but it may be because I don't like quinoa.
Good, it could use a bit more flavor though.
Great recipe, loved the cumin! Only thing I changed was cooking the Quinoa with low sodium chicken broth instead of water and it tasted great!
Wonderful flavor with the oregano and cumin! I also added some pink sea salt and make this recipe exactly as written. I would make this again!

Family really like this! The 5 year old said it wasn't his favorite but he still ate it while the 3 year old had two helpings of it! Made it a side with some chicken thighs and added corn, peas and carrots to it. Cooked the quinoa in chicken broth (2 cups.) The possibilities are endless with this recipe and looking forward to trying other varieties! Thanks!
This was good. I would definitely use chicken or veggie stock in place of water next time (if it's on hand).
Very basic recipe to add flavors to your quinoa. The only thing I did differently was to sauté my green onion with the garlic. Very nutritious.

I love quinoa, because it's so much healthier than rice and this was a nice recipe especially because you can add whatever veggies you like. Next time i would use less oregano, i didn't love in the dish but that's just personal preference. To those pointing out that the cooking ratio is 2 cups of water per cup of quinoa, that's right, however this recipe uses a different metod where you use more water than needed and just drain it when it reaches your desired doneness (like cooking pasta). I have done rice this way, just adding way more water than needed (no measurement) and then draining it when it was done and it's actually very good if you have trouble making rice. If you don't like this method just stick to the normal liquid/ quinoa ratio :)
Very tasty! I didn't use corn; instead I used what I had on hand: red pepper, asparagus, mushrooms. Red onion instead of green onions. Very nice way to use quinoa!
this is time to star eat healthy=)
Love Love Love
Very good! Thought 3 tablespoons of olive oil was too much. Next time I'll use 2. Otherwise it was very tasty.
I felt it needed something else ... maybe too much quinoa.

I am trying to learn to like quinoa, and this dish definitely brought me a littler closer! I used frozen peas & carrots in place of the corn (personal preference) and added a can of black beans as recommended by previous reviews. Very important to note that the flavor was much better after a couple of days of the flavors melding in the frig. When I reheated it I melted some shredded sharp cheddar cheese on top and it was downright yummy! Kids still aren't crazy about it, they think it might be better with some meat added.
Yum! First Quinoa recipe I've tried that had enough flavor for the whole family. We loved it.
Tasted great with the cumin - I also added carrots and mushrooms!

Very good, basic quinoa recipe. I used 2 1/4 cups water (one of those I used veg. broth) as the package recommends. Simmering for 20 minutes was perfect. I loved the idea of cooking the carrot in the water. It was soft after 10 minutes. I find stir frying the carrots they never get soft. I added chopped sugar snap peas, chopped red onion and everything else as the recipe called for. Very colorful, very tasty.
This was my first time eating or making Quinoa. I thought it was okay. It could have used more flavor.

I liked this recipe but I did make a couple changes. First of all, rinse the quinoa well with cold water before cooking. I cooked the quinoa as directed on the package (2c liquid per 1c quinoa) which is a cup less than the recipe states. I used beef broth instead of water. I will be trying vegetable broth and chicken broth in the future as well. By using less liquid there is no need to drain it after cooking. I used a can of garden vegetable medley (corn, green beans, carrots) instead of half a cup of corn. I didn't have garlic so I used two green onions (green part included) instead. I put them in with the peppers after they had softened up some. I didn't put salt or pepper in it because the broth is salty enough and pepper can be put on according to each persons own taste preference. I'll make it again using different liquids and veggies. It's quite tasty!
Nice but you couldn't taste the herbs and spices :( so was a bit bland i added lemon juice yum! but this recipe made TOO MUCH QUINOA and not enough vegies! still tasted good!
very tasty!

This was a fine side dish. My 1 year old loved it which makes me a happy mama. The cumin gave the quinoa a wonderful aroma, but the taste was lacking a bit so I'll pump it up with some spices next time.
Delicious!

I'm not crazy about quinoa. I was looking for a little more flavor than I had found in other recipes. This was amazing! Didn't have red peppers so I subbed green ones. Didn't have green onions so I added about a Tbs of yellow onion. Will definitely make again.
Made exactly as recipe, pretty good, go light on the spices.
needs a sauce

This was my first run at quinoa. I discovered that quinoa takes on the flavour around it, on it's own it tastes like socks. I followed the recipe but did add to it, couple pinches of dried onion powder, half tsp or more dried garlic powder, bit of extra salt...and you know what? It's rather nice.

Loved it! I made this recipe with 2 cups of vegetable broth as many commented 3 cups of water was too much. It also matched the package directions. I used red quinoa. It tasted great hot. I cooled it overnight and added crumbled feta cheese and grape tomatoes to make a cold side dish for a party. It was very tasty and everyone seemed to like it. I will definitely make it again!
It was extremely bland, even with using chicken broth instead of water for the quinoa.
Excellent! Finally a healthy recipe that my family eats without complaining that it's "healthy"! A great way to sneak in the "dreadful" greens!
nice..

Divine! I roasted some sweet potatoes, acorn squash, carrots, and onions instead of the veggies listed in this recipe. Once these babies were roasted to my liking, I sautéd 2 garlic cloves in some olive oil for about 2 minutes... then, I added about a 1/2 of a head of kale, coating the kale in the olive/garlic oil in the frying pan. The kale softens up a little fast (be careful to not over cook the kale!). Once the kale, quinoa and the roasted veggies were all done to perfection, I layered the ingredients in a serving bowl and Wham!... Amazing!!!! Will definitely make it again!

Also read another reviewer's comment about adding some veggie broth in the quinoa water for a little flavor. This dish has tons of flavor so beware... make extra!!!!

THIS DISH WAS HEAVEN!
My wife wanted me to a-d-d a couple things to it, so I did, and with them added, I have to admit, this RECIPE was the best thing ever!
First, instead of Quinoa I made this with Cous Cous! It had great bite to it and tasted A-O-K!
Instead of Veggies I cut up Portuguese sausage and corn niblets, frozen instead of from a can WHICH WORKED okay. And the corn was also from a can.
Perfect for company!
This was pretty good!

I've never had quinoa before but gave this a shot. I cooked it in 2 cups chicken broth, one cup water. I sauted the garlic, added tri colored peppers, a little green pepper, broccoli, frozen green peas, and frozen corn. I also added some butter to the olive oil for flavor, the cumin, and the oregano and a touch of crushed red pepper. I served it with chopped green onions.

Both hubby and I thought it was too bland. I added walnuts and sunflower seeds to mine, he added raspberry walnut vinaigrette dressing to his. His was delicious, mine was OK.

I gave it three stars cause of it being bland. I'll try it again, but adjust the seasoning. Maybe my spices are to old.
I used this as a base, but used chicken broth for part of the water and for veges I used carrots, zucchini, corn and some kale. Yum!
Delicious! I didn't change a thing, but I'm sure it would be good with other veggies too.
Edible, but not something I will make again. For my taste buds, there are better quinoa recipes on here. I cut the oil down to 2 tablespoons & think using the full amount would be really greasy.

This dish was very tasty. I doubled it up for a group of 8 and added extra cumin and orgegano. I also added some frozen beans and added them at the same time as the frozen corn and red peppers. Everyone loved it.

This idea gets 5 stars from me. I used zucchini,red bell,and peas they were a perfect match. I also used Garam Masala spice instead of just Cumin.I was reaching for my Cumin when I saw the Masala it has Cumin in it and I thought what the hay. It was very very good. If I hadn't seen this recipe and the poster hadn't pointed out other vegetables that would work just as deliciously my Quinoa would still be sitting on my shelf unused and unappreciated. So for the inspiration this recipe gave me I give it 5 stars.

This recipe is good, but does end up pretty bland. I added a sprinkling of freshly grated Parmesan and it gave it that edge of flavour that it needed to really be a satisfying meal. Also added some leftover mixed frozen veggies (carrot/lima bean/peas/green beans)cherry tomatoes and substituted coriander for the cumin. Also finely chopped a little bit of onion and added with the other veggies, as I didn't have any green onions.

Didn't take too much prep and was ready in just over 30 minutes (I had an issue with my bell pepper, so was a bit delayed) which is a huge pro for a mom of 2 who doesn't have a lot of cooking experience!

My 2 year old loves it and my picky husband is eating it! Very pleased and will be making this again!
Vey tasty.
Added zuchinni, carrots, black beans and cooked with regular onions instead of using green onions. Turned out great! Even my veggie hating, quinoa resistant husband liked it.

I made this for a quick lunch for my mother-in-law Everyone loved it, even my mother-in-law who is not an adventurous eater. I did make some changes though. I used up some homemade chicken broth instead of straight water, sauteed onion and garlic before adding the corn which was leftover from the farmer's market. I forgot to add the cumin but it was good without it. I did squeeze a little bit of lemon over it all at the end with a final drizzle of olive oil. Yum.
This wasn't bad. I found it quite bland though, which is surprising for me as I generally like my food to be bland. I will make again, but will probably experiment for more flavor.
This wasn't bad. I found it quite bland though, which is surprising for me as I generally like my food to be bland. I will make again, but will probably experiment for more flavor.

We have used quinoa for years due to dietary considerations. Our recipes often combine it with barley, rice or Cavena Nuda. 
This is a new, (to us) delicious idea which would easily adapt to Asian stir fry’s. Using the basic concept, we added Cajun spice mix, tomatoes and okra. Yum!
Thanks for the post!
A friend of mine made this for a recent picnic. The only thing she did different was to add lime juice. Wonderful dish!
Very good. Followed exactly. Everyone liked it. Will make again.
simple to make but a good quick side dish

This was my first experience with Quinoa. I also added peas, carrots, water chestnuts and some feta cheese. I am not a fan of oregano and it was over powering so I added soy sauce. Really yummy. Next time I will double the veggies. Thanks for sharing.
This was good but a little bland. Not sure what to add next time. Maybe more veges.
Very good. I think a little hot sauce makes this taste great, and if you want it as a burrito filling, add some cheese and fill a tortilla.
Very tasty.
I made this with chicken broth and used the exact veggies listed here - I loved it! I have been wanting to try quinoa and this was a great introduction to it. My kids loved it as well.

This was great! I used chicken broth instead of water while cooking the quinoa. It's only the second time I've had quinoa so I don't have much to compare it to but it was waaay more tasty than the other dish. I'll definitely make this again, my girlfriend also loved it.

Loved this! I took some suggestions and substituted 1-1/2 cups of the water with chicken broth. I also added zucchini, yellow squash, celery, leeks, carrot, and bell pepper. I will definitely make this again!

super easy and yummy! After reading others reviews I think I will try cooking it in broth instead of water next time. I also used the leftovers to make turkey quinoa meatloaf, also from this site. It's great when a recipe can do double duty!!

Love love this recipe... we sautéed in butter the veggies. Our selections were....onions, yellow peppers, zucchini squash and peas. We use chicken broth (2 cups) no water. Didn't have to drain. Cumin is the spice that really makes this go from good to spectacular. I put in 1 teaspoon. Hubby not a quinoa fan thinks it is too bland, but loves this recipe. Asks for this instead of the fancy multi-grain rice I cook. Yummy!
I'm a big fan of quinoa, so tried this recipe. I found it to be bland and boring.

Delicious! I added a can of diced tomatoes to the quinoa (just 2 c. water) and about 1/2 cup frozen spinach to the garlic & corn saute. I then mixed everything together, stuffed it inside some bell peppers, baked for 30 minutes @ 400, and topped the peppers with shredded pepper jack cheese just before serving. Very tasty, and very filling.
